Package moulton.scalable.clickables

The clickables package contains classes that pertain to menu components that can be clicked. This package contains the abstract class Clickable, which all clickable components derive from, as well as RadioButton, which is the generalized ancestor for any rectangular button components.

Each clickable component has an identification string, which is used internally to keep track of components. The identification string has no inherent meaning otherwise, so it can be assigned arbitrarily at the programmer's choice.

  • Interface Summary
    Interface Description
    EventAction
    The EventAction is an interface serving like a functor.
    TouchResponsiveComponent
    Interface for components that should be responsive to being touched, meaning having the mouse cursor on part of them that would in most cases be clickable.
  • Class Summary
    Class Description
    Button
    A menu component that is a simple rectangular button with optional frontal text saved as Button.text.
    Clickable
    Ancestor class for components that are clickable.
    FormButton
    The Form Button is a button specially adapted to work with forms.
    RadioButton
    A button where only one in the group can be clicked at a time.
    RadioGroup
    Holds RadioButtons.
